securely.translation[0].definitions[0].d: tied, fastened etc tightly, especially in order to make something safe
securely.translation[0].definitions[0].e: All firearms should be kept securely locked in a cabinet.
securely.translation[0].definitions[1].d: in a way that protects something from being stolen or lost
securely.translation[0].definitions[1].e: Customers can now buy products securely over the Internet.
securely.translation[0].definitions[2].d: in a way that is likely to continue successfully and not change
securely.translation[0].definitions[2].e: By that time, democracy had become securely established in Spain.
